ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] secondary resists
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve had that problem for as long as I ve had Pixie.  Some times I have lots of success (once held a frog shaman and an icebone for 30s while my root wore off)
ygData.messageBody:
I've had that problem for as long as I've had Pixie. Some times I have
lots of success (once held a frog shaman and an icebone for 30s while
my root wore off) and sometimes I have 75%+ resist rates. I was chain
striking last night to augment a 2 paladin 1 cleric stun session to
keep cenobites from healing. I got so many resists that, had it not
been for the cenos, I'd remove it from my list. I find it working
nicely on low blues and greens, that's it. 131cha w/ & w/o mino horn
it chows.

Ninev Rudeflute
35th and going to try my hand at charming HGs in Rathe
E'ci


--- "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...> wrote:
>
> Anyone notice a change in Pixie Strike? I have used it before and
> gotten
> resisted quite a bit, but last night was the first time I ever saw
> the
> secondary resist message like Lullaby has. Was this added at the
> same time
> as Lullaby's was or later? It was taking me 3-4 applications to get
> it to
> stick which made it useless for mezzing casters.

*sneep*

> Kitasi
